thread.title: Bears rally in fourth quarter to Beat Chiefs 18-17
thread.title_full: Bears rally in fourth quarter to Beat Chiefs 18-17

author: DAVE SKRETTA
title: Bears rally in fourth quarter to Beat Chiefs 18-17
text:
Ed Zurga Bears rally in fourth quarter to Beat Chiefs 18-17 
Kansas City Chiefs running back Jamaal Charles (25) is helped off the field after an injury in the second half of an NFL football game against the Chicago Bears in Kansas City, Mo., Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. (AP Photo/Ed Zurga) Ed Zurga Bears rally in fourth quarter to Beat Chiefs 18-17 
Kansas City Chiefs head coach Andy Reid looks at the scoreboard during the second half of an NFL football game against the Chicago Bears in Kansas City, Mo., Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. (AP Photo/Ed Zurga) Charlie Riedel Bears rally in fourth quarter to Beat Chiefs 18-17 
Chicago Bears quarterback Jay Cutler (6) looks for a receiver during the first half of an NFL football game against the Kansas City Chiefs in Kansas City, Mo., Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. (AP Photo/Charlie Riedel) Charlie Riedel Bears rally in fourth quarter to Beat Chiefs 18-17 
Chicago Bears quarterback Jay Cutler (6) throws during the first half of an NFL football game against the Kansas City Chiefs in Kansas City, Mo., Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. (AP Photo/Charlie Riedel) Charlie Riedel Bears rally in fourth quarter to Beat Chiefs 18-17 
Chicago Bears safety Adrian Amos (38) tackles Kansas City Chiefs wide receiver Jeremy Maclin (19) with cornerback Alan Ball (24) looking on during the first half of an NFL football game in Kansas City, Mo., Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. (AP Photo/Charlie Riedel) Posted: Sunday, October 11, 2015 1:29 pm Bears rally in fourth quarter to Beat Chiefs 18-17 Associated Press | 
KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) â€” Jay Cutler led Chicago to a pair of fourth-quarter touchdowns, including an alert toss to running back Matt Forte with 18 seconds left, giving the Bears a stunning 18-17 victory over the Kansas City Chiefs on Sunday. 
The Bears (2-3) trailed 17-3 early in the third quarter when Chiefs running back Jamaal Charles went down with a potentially serious knee injury. Kansas City's offense quickly dropped off, and that allowed Chicago to mount a comeback for its second straight last-minute win.
